channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Review on Anchor Assignment and Sampling Heuristics in Deep Learning-based Object Detection
item.description: Deep learning-based object detection is a fundamental but challenging problem in computer vision field, has attracted a lot of study in recent years.

item.title: Bi-PointFlowNet: Bidirectional Learning for Point Cloud Based Scene Flow Estimation
item.description: Scene flow estimation, which extracts point-wise motion between scenes, is becoming a crucial task in many computer vision tasks.

item.title: Multi-Object Tracking and Segmentation via Neural Message Passing
item.description: We achieve state-of-the-art results for both tracking and segmentation in several publicly available datasets.

item.title: A Systematic Review and Replicability Study of BERT4Rec for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: We also propose our own implementation of BERT4Rec based on the Hugging Face Transformers library, which we demonstrate replicates the originally reported results on 3 out 4 datasets, while requiring up to 95% less training time to converge.

item.title: A Probabilistic Autoencoder for Type Ia Supernovae Spectral Time Series
item.description: We construct a physically-parameterized probabilistic autoencoder (PAE) to learn the intrinsic diversity of type Ia supernovae (SNe Ia) from a sparse set of spectral time series.

item.title: ScaleNet: Searching for the Model to Scale
item.description: Recently, community has paid increasing attention on model scaling and contributed to developing a model family with a wide spectrum of scales.

item.title: DeepSolar tracker: towards unsupervised assessment with open-source data of the accuracy of deep learning-based distributed PV mapping
item.description: However, distributed PV generation, which amounts to half of the PV energy generation, makes it increasingly difficult for transmission system operators (TSOs) to balance the load and supply and avoid grid congestions.

item.title: Short-Term Trajectory Prediction for Full-Immersive Multiuser Virtual Reality with Redirected Walking
item.description: Full-immersive multiuser Virtual Reality (VR) envisions supporting unconstrained mobility of the users in the virtual worlds, while at the same time constraining their physical movements inside VR setups through redirected walking.

item.title: Parameterization of Cross-Token Relations with Relative Positional Encoding for Vision MLP
item.description: They use token-mixing layers to capture cross-token interactions, as opposed to the multi-head self-attention mechanism used by Transformers.

item.title: DuetFace: Collaborative Privacy-Preserving Face Recognition via Channel Splitting in the Frequency Domain
item.description: To compensate, the method introduces a plug-in interactive block to allow attention transfer from the client-side by producing a feature mask.

item.title: Continual Learning For On-Device Environmental Sound Classification
item.description: Experimental results on the DCASE 2019 Task 1 and ESC-50 dataset show that our proposed method outperforms baseline continual learning methods on classification accuracy and computational efficiency, indicating our method can efficiently and incrementally learn new classes without the catastrophic forgetting problem for on-device environmental sound classification.

item.title: Towards Better Dermoscopic Image Feature Representation Learning for Melanoma Classification
item.description: Deep learning-based melanoma classification with dermoscopic images has recently shown great potential in automatic early-stage melanoma diagnosis.

item.title: Modeling Quality and Machine Learning Pipelines through Extended Feature Models
item.description: Over the years, several solutions have been proposed to automate the building of ML pipelines, most of them focused on semantic aspects and characteristics of the input dataset.

item.title: 3D Instances as 1D Kernels
item.description: The idea of instance kernel is inspired by recent success of dynamic convolutions in 2D/3D instance segmentation.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Face Recognition with Learnable Privacy Budgets in Frequency Domain
item.description: This paper proposes a privacy-preserving face recognition method using differential privacy in the frequency domain.

item.title: Augmenting Softmax Information for Selective Classification with Out-of-Distribution Data
item.description: However, the performance of detection methods is generally evaluated on the task in isolation, rather than also considering potential downstream tasks in tandem.

item.title: Plex: Towards Reliability using Pretrained Large Model Extensions
item.description: A recent trend in artificial intelligence is the use of pretrained models for language and vision tasks, which have achieved extraordinary performance but also puzzling failures.

item.title: Algorithms to estimate Shapley value feature attributions
item.description: Based on the various feature removal approaches, we describe the multiple types of Shapley value feature attributions and methods to calculate each one.

item.title: WaveGAN: Frequency-aware GAN for High-Fidelity Few-shot Image Generation
item.description: Concretely, we disentangle encoded features into multiple frequency components and perform low-frequency skip connections to preserve outline and structural information.

item.title: Outlier detection of vital sign trajectories from COVID-19 patients
item.description: We also show, descriptively, how epochs transition from normal to abnormal for one such patient.

item.title: STRIKE-GOLDD 4.0: user-friendly, efficient analysis of structural identifiability and observability
item.description: Here we present STRIKE-GOLDD 4. 0, which includes a new algorithm, ProbObsTest, specifically designed for the analysis of rational models.

item.title: Modeling Non-Cooperative Dialogue: Theoretical and Empirical Insights
item.description: We use the tools of learning theory to develop a theoretical model for identifying non-cooperative interlocutors and apply this theory to analyze different communication strategies.

item.title: MIMO-DoAnet: Multi-channel Input and Multiple Outputs DoA Network with Unknown Number of Sound Sources
item.description: These algorithms are usually achieved by mapping the multi-channel audio input to the single output (i. e. overall spatial pseudo-spectrum (SPS) of all sources), that is called MISO.

item.title: ST-P3: End-to-end Vision-based Autonomous Driving via Spatial-Temporal Feature Learning
item.description: In particular, we propose a spatial-temporal feature learning scheme towards a set of more representative features for perception, prediction and planning tasks simultaneously, which is called ST-P3.

item.title: Communication-Efficient Diffusion Strategy for Performance Improvement of Federated Learning with Non-IID Data
item.description: To address the aforementioned challenge, we propose a novel diffusion strategy of the machine learning (ML) model (FedDif) to maximize the FL performance with non-IID data.

item.title: CheXplaining in Style: Counterfactual Explanations for Chest X-rays using StyleGAN
item.description: Deep learning models used in medical image analysis are prone to raising reliability concerns due to their black-box nature.

item.title: 3DVerifier: Efficient Robustness Verification for 3D Point Cloud Models
item.description: Thus, we propose an efficient verification framework, 3DVerifier, to tackle both challenges by adopting a linear relaxation function to bound the multiplication layer and combining forward and backward propagation to compute the certified bounds of the outputs of the point cloud models.

item.title: Registration based Few-Shot Anomaly Detection
item.description: Inspired by how humans detect anomalies, i. e., comparing an image in question to normal images, we here leverage registration, an image alignment task that is inherently generalizable across categories, as the proxy task, to train a category-agnostic anomaly detection model.

item.title: Diverse Human Motion Prediction via Gumbel-Softmax Sampling from an Auxiliary Space
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel sampling strategy for sampling very diverse results from an imbalanced multimodal distribution learned by a deep generative model.

item.title: Point-to-Box Network for Accurate Object Detection via Single Point Supervision
item.description: To address this problem, we introduce a lightweight alternative to the off-the-shelf proposal (OTSP) method and thereby create the Point-to-Box Network (P2BNet), which can construct an inter-objects balanced proposal bag by generating proposals in an anchor-like way.

item.title: GeoSegNet: Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation via Geometric Encoder-Decoder Modeling
item.description: Semantic segmentation of point clouds, aiming to assign each point a semantic category, is critical to 3D scene understanding. Despite of significant advances in recent years, most of existing methods still suffer from either the object-level misclassification or the boundary-level ambiguity.

item.title: DavarOCR: A Toolbox for OCR and Multi-Modal Document Understanding
item.description: Compared with the previous opensource OCR toolbox, DavarOCR has relatively more complete support for the sub-tasks of the cutting-edge technology of document understanding.

item.title: Octuplet Loss: Make Face Recognition Robust to Image Resolution
item.description: To address this problem, we propose a novel combination of the popular triplet loss to improve robustness against image resolution via fine-tuning of existing face recognition models.

item.title: E2FIF: Push the limit of Binarized Deep Imagery Super-resolution using End-to-end Full-precision Information Flow
item.description: Binary neural network (BNN) provides a promising solution to deploy parameter-intensive deep single image super-resolution (SISR) models onto real devices with limited storage and computational resources.

item.title: Prototypical Contrast Adaptation for Domain Adaptive Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation (UDA) aims to adapt the model trained on the labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain.

item.title: ObjectBox: From Centers to Boxes for Anchor-Free Object Detection
item.description: We present ObjectBox, a novel single-stage anchor-free and highly generalizable object detection approach.

item.title: Tackling Background Distraction in Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised video object segmentation (VOS) aims to densely track certain designated objects in videos.

item.title: Learning Implicit Templates for Point-Based Clothed Human Modeling
item.description: We present FITE, a First-Implicit-Then-Explicit framework for modeling human avatars in clothing.

item.title: Language Modelling with Pixels
item.description: Language models are defined over a finite set of inputs, which creates a vocabulary bottleneck when we attempt to scale the number of supported languages.

item.title: Scene Text Recognition with Permuted Autoregressive Sequence Models
item.description: Context-aware STR methods typically use internal autoregressive (AR) language models (LM).

item.title: Towards Grand Unification of Object Tracking
item.description: We present a unified method, termed Unicorn, that can simultaneously solve four tracking problems (SOT, MOT, VOS, MOTS) with a single network using the same model parameters.

item.title: Spatiotemporal Propagation Learning for Network-Wide Flight Delay Prediction
item.description: By this means, STPN allows cross-talk of spatial and temporal factors for modeling delay propagation.

item.title: Benchmarking Omni-Vision Representation through the Lens of Visual Realms
item.description: We benchmark ReCo and other advances in omni-vision representation studies that are different in architectures (from CNNs to transformers) and in learning paradigms (from supervised learning to self-supervised learning) on OmniBenchmark.

item.title: XMem: Long-Term Video Object Segmentation with an Atkinson-Shiffrin Memory Model
item.description: We present XMem, a video object segmentation architecture for long videos with unified feature memory stores inspired by the Atkinson-Shiffrin memory model.

item.title: Convolutional Bypasses Are Better Vision Transformer Adapters
item.description: Motivated by parameter-efficient transfer learning (PETL) on language transformers, recent studies attempt to insert lightweight adaptation modules (e. g., adapter layers or prompt tokens) to pretrained ViT and only finetune these modules while the pretrained weights are frozen.

item.title: MedFuse: Multi-modal fusion with clinical time-series data and chest X-ray images
item.description: Multi-modal fusion approaches aim to integrate information from different data sources.

item.title: A Multi-Modality Ovarian Tumor Ultrasound Image Dataset for Unsupervised Cross-Domain Semantic Segmentation
item.description: To solve this problem, we propose a Multi-Modality Ovarian Tumor Ultrasound (MMOTU) image dataset containing 1469 2d ultrasound images and 170 contrast enhanced ultrasonography (CEUS) images with pixel-wise and global-wise annotations.

item.title: Pose-based Tremor Classification for Parkinson's Disease Diagnosis from Video
item.description: To this end, we propose to classify Parkinson's tremor since it is one of the most predominant symptoms of PD with strong generalizability.

item.title: An Asymmetric Contrastive Loss for Handling Imbalanced Datasets
item.description: In addition, we propose the asymmetric focal contrastive loss (AFCL) as a further generalization of both ACL and focal contrastive loss (FCL).

item.title: PASHA: Efficient HPO with Progressive Resource Allocation
item.description: Hyperparameter optimization (HPO) and neural architecture search (NAS) are methods of choice to obtain the best-in-class machine learning models, but in practice they can be costly to run.
